comments.body: Why do we have both the preview & non-preview paths here? Happy to discuss offline

Just because we have it for all the other endpoints. I did not want this to behave differently from the others (e.g. I am not sure if R client does not use preview still?) We should remove them all at once I think.
looks like the threshold is actually 20000 ?

Although it is acceptable to make a breaking change prior to MLflow 1.0, we should double-check the behavior with respect to serialized proto JSON. I suspect that int-y strings will be parsed correctly by the Python deserializer.

Could we run such a test -- running this code against an old version of the server, and confirming that it works?

I have not added  old server tests. But I did add reading string experiment_id as int. Specifically for Metric timestamp(any int64) since the same deserializer is used throughout. 

If that is not enough, I can keep an old service.proto and it's generated service_pb2.py, and parametrize handlers.py so we can test against both versions in test_handlers.py and test_rest_tracking.py
I ran the new client against an old server with the updated backcompat helper and it passed the tests.
Used `new_name` to distinguish from the fact that we sometimes use `experiment_name` as an identifier for an experiment.
@stbof Could you rerun `generate-protos.sh` in the root of mlflow and commit the results?
